env module

class env.cstr_env[source]

Bases: Env

calculate_errors(state)[source]

Calculate the error between the current ‘state’ vector \([C_A, C_B, T_R, T_K]\) and reference state \([C_{A, ref}, C_{B, ref}, T_{R, ref}, T_{K, ref}]\).

Arguments :

state (array): current state of the precess.

Return :

errors (array): errors of the of current state

calculate_integral_errors()[source]

Calculate the integral error between of current ‘state’ vector \([C_A, C_B, T_R, T_K]\) Arguments :

Return :

integral errors (array) :

calculate_reward(x_next, u_curr, u_prev)[source]

calculate reward funtion is used to calculate the reward value for state \(S_t\) at time instant t. Arguments :

x_next(array) : next state when take the action \(A_t\) at the state \(S_t\). u_curr (array) : action at the current time instant t. u_prev (array) : action at the previous time instatn t-1.

initial_sa()[source]

function setpoint is used to give the initial state for the current episode (this is one of the steady state of the process ).

is_done(x_next)[source]

Check the done condition i.e. weather the last five consecutive states are within the defined epsilon or not.

reset()[source]

Reset functions is called at start of each episode. It is used to give the initial state to agent and set the goal state.

save_episode_data()[source]
setpoint()[source]

function setpoint is used to give the reference state / goal state to the current episode. (this is one of the steady state of the process )

step(s_action)[source]

Step function take the action of the agent and returns the next-observation to the agent.
